And there's one way you can ensure they do by adding a circuit breaker. So this effectively says if the portfolio loses more than X percent, whatever that percent is, that you will then begin closing positions because it means something is gone drastically wrong. You can't just pick a random number because it needs to be fit to the strategies that you're running and the size of the portfolio and the kind of things that you're doing. So the way that we figure out a circuit breaker is by literally analyzing the strategies, the average PNL, the average drawdown for our strategies and then arriving at this number.
